titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller University records, Special Events and Activities, Medical Electronics Center
A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, Special Events and Activities, Medical Electronics Center FA877

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-11-01 03:23:41 -0400.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller University records, Special Events and Activities, Medical Electronics Center

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: In 1955 a Medical Electronics Center was temporarily established at the Rockefeller Institute in order to improve contact between electronic specialists and medical and biological scientists.
Vladimir K. Zworykin directed the investigations in search of new applications of electronics in biology and medicine.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of the RAC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Both volumes prepared by the Medical Electronics Center of The Rockefeller Institute, published by Professional Group on Medical Electronics and the Institute of Radio Engineers with the additional support of National Institute of Arthritis and Metabolic Diseases; National Institutes of Health; U.S. Public Health Service.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: ALL VOLUMES REMOVED TO RAC LIBRARY 8/9/1988.
